jobs_results.title: Senior iOS Developer
jobs_results.description:
EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to having a positive impact on our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multi-national teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. No matter where you are located, you will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential.

We are looking for a motivated Senior iOS Developer to join our Budapest office, who open to new challenges and with a willingness to learn. If you want to boost your career with a global leader in digital transformation, EPAM is the perfect choice. If you‚Äôd like to learn more about this position and project, apply now.

RESPONSIBILITIES
‚Ä¢ Develop new and modify existing mobile apps in accordance to industry best practices, using Swift as the programming language
‚Ä¢ Implement test and data driven development methodologies to deliver on essential software requirements (functions, performance, design constraints, attributes) and its external interfaces
‚Ä¢ Participate in Scrum ceremonies
‚Ä¢ Participate in code review, estimations and design sessions
‚Ä¢ Communicate with designers and PO
‚Ä¢ Create technical documentation including high-quality documentation of code

REQUIREMENTS
‚Ä¢ At least 5 years of hands-on experience with iOS mobile development
‚Ä¢ Expert knowledge of Swift and deep understanding of iOS SDK
‚Ä¢ Experience in working with REST API
‚Ä¢ Experience with engineering practices like code review, unit testing, branching and etc
‚Ä¢ Good understanding of Design Patterns (especially MVVM)
‚Ä¢ Performance and memory profiling/optimization skills
‚Ä¢ Experience with Accessibility features implementation
‚Ä¢ Expected to be self-managing, take technical responsibility for a feature, work without supervision and test the code thoroughly using test cases
‚Ä¢ Good communication skills in English (both oral and written form)

WE OFFER
‚Ä¢ Dynamic, entrepreneurial corporate environment
‚Ä¢ Diverse multicultural, multi-functional, and multilingual work environment
‚Ä¢ Opportunities for personal and career growth in a progressive industry
‚Ä¢ Global scope, international projects
‚Ä¢ Widespread training and development opportunities
‚Ä¢ Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutions
‚Ä¢ Competitive salary and various benefits
‚Ä¢ Advanced wellbeing and CSR programs, recreation area

jobs_results.title: Senior iOS Developer (Remote)
jobs_results.description:
üöÄ What's the position?

This is a Full-time Senior iOS Developer position at Neybox for talented individuals who want to work on cutting-edge applications that positively impact the well-being of individuals worldwide.

üí´ What will I be working on?

You'll be working on our two apps: Pillow, a sleep-tracking app, and Today, which is a quantified-self wellness app.

Both apps have won an Editors' Choice distinction and have been featured multiple times in press and media. They have millions of users worldwide and a great roadmap ahead.

üßë‚Äçüíª What will be my role and responsibilities?

As a senior developer you will be responsible for
‚Ä¢ Building new features
‚Ä¢ Fixing bugs
‚Ä¢ Maintaining the existing codebase
‚Ä¢ Writting Unit Tests for existing and new features
‚Ä¢ Making sure the documentation of the project is accurate and helpful
‚Ä¢ Doing research on new technologies and frameworks
‚Ä¢ ‚ö†Ô∏èThis is a position that requires a commitment of 40 hours per week. This is not a part-time position.

üõ†Ô∏è What's the tech stack?

In a nutshell:

Both our apps are written in Swift (MVVM and MVC).

The UI is written in SwiftUI and UIKit.

We write Unit Tests; the code is clean and well-documented.

We make extensive use of various frameworks and machine learning.

Both apps are available for iOS only.

üåç Can I work remotely?

Of course! Our team is 100% remote. We have flexible working hours, but a good overlap between our time zones is required.

üôå What is it like working at Neybox?

Our team is small by design (6-8 people). However, we work closely together every day (Mon-Fri). For coordination, we use Slack and Jira and keep meetings at a minimum.

There's no middle management to get in the way, and we encourage new ideas and close collaboration.

üíº What are the requirements?
‚Ä¢ 4+ years of iOS development experience in Swift
‚Ä¢ Experience in HealthKit, CoreML SwiftUI, UIKit, Core Animation, GCD, Core Data, and WatchKit.
‚Ä¢ Experience working with Git version control, Unit testing, and Continuous Integration
‚Ä¢ Experience in performance profiling with Instruments on Xcode.
‚Ä¢ Proficient use of English, both writing and speaking.
‚Ä¢ Willingness to learn and experiment with new technologies.
‚Ä¢ References from previous employers in written or spoken form may be required from previous employers.
‚Ä¢ Proficient in usage of MacOS and iOS.

üì• Great! How can I apply?

Just hit "Apply" button below!

‚ö†Ô∏è Please note that this is the only acceptable way to apply. All other ways of contacting Neybox about the position (social media, LinkedIn, email etc.), will result in immediate rejection.

jobs_results.title: iOS Developer
jobs_results.description:
We are seeking an experienced iOS Developer to play a key role in helping Flexion expand into the iOS ecosystem with a primary focus on payment integration and implementing payment SDKs. You will drive the development of iOS solutions, mirroring the success of our Android products, while developing features, conducting R&D, understanding the full ecosystem, and approaching challenges with an entrepreneurial and doer mindset.

You will also work with frameworks such as Unity Engine to deliver seamless, high-quality solutions. Collaboration with cross-functional teams is essential for success in this role.

jobs_results.title: iOS Developer
jobs_results.description:
What we offer
‚Ä¢ High level of autonomy in a laid-back environment
‚Ä¢ Great learning and networking opportunities with experienced colleagues
‚Ä¢ An international and multicultural squad
‚Ä¢ Certifications and Training, partnerships
‚Ä¢ Language learning program License for online tech platform and others
‚Ä¢ Mentoring & Buddy Programs
‚Ä¢ Job Rotation
‚Ä¢ Flexible & partial home office policy
‚Ä¢ Great chances for career growth

We are looking for an IOS developer in Debrecen with Home Office or Remote work options.

Your Tasks
‚Ä¢ Apply mobile application expertise on the iOS platform to improve experience
‚Ä¢ Work with customers, designers and UX experts to design and develop solutions to challenging problems
‚Ä¢ Provide leadership to development teams and mentor junior developers by setting up standards and best practices for the entire project

Your Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Great English skills - You'll communicate with international teams!
‚Ä¢ Experience of Objective-C based iOS development
‚Ä¢ Proficient with Swift
‚Ä¢ Experience with iOS frameworks such as UIKit, Core Data, Core Animation, etc.
‚Ä¢ Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect iOS applications to back-end services
‚Ä¢ Understanding of Apple‚Äôs design principles and interface guidelines
‚Ä¢ Experience working with Cocoapods and open source libraries.
‚Ä¢ Experience with performance and memory tuning with Instruments tool.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with cloud message APIs and push notifications
‚Ä¢ Solid understanding of the application design patterns like MVC, MVVM, VIPER etc.
‚Ä¢ Proficient understanding of Git
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with continuous integration ex: Jenkins CI tool. Good to have, not mandatory.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Unit Testing e.g. XCTest, Mock objects etc.

jobs_results.title: iOS Developer
jobs_results.description:
We are seeking an experienced iOS Developer to play a key role in helping Flexion expand into the iOS ecosystem with a primary focus on payment integration and implementing payment SDKs. You will drive the development of iOS solutions, mirroring the success of our Android products, while developing features, conducting R&D, understanding the full ecosystem, and approaching challenges with an entrepreneurial and doer mindset.

You will also work with frameworks such as Unity Engine to deliver seamless, high-quality solutions. Collaboration with cross-functional teams is essential for success in this role.

jobs_results.title: Software Engineer (iOS)
jobs_results.description:
About the role

We are looking for iOS Software Engineer with mid/senior-level technical skills and experience to join our client in the Banking/Financial sector to work on new application development projects. You will join a distributed multicultural team of engineers working on high-impact projects and join. Also, in this role, we will invite a new colleague to come to the client's office 3 times a week.

What you will do
‚Ä¢ Design and develop iOS applications, ensuring high performance, responsiveness, and reliability
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features
‚Ä¢ Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency
‚Ä¢ Maintain and improve existing codebases and peer review code changes
‚Ä¢ Troubleshoot and debug to optimize performance
‚Ä¢ Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and emerging mobile technologies

Skills and qualities we appreciate
‚Ä¢ Proven experience as an iOS Developer with a strong portfolio of applications developed
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in Swift and Objective-C
‚Ä¢ Solid understanding of the full mobile development life cycle
‚Ä¢ Experience working with remote data via REST and JSON
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of code versioning tools, such as Git
‚Ä¢ Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for quality and performance
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and teamwork skills
‚Ä¢ Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and as part of a team
‚Ä¢ Willingness to adapt to new technologies and learn continuously
‚Ä¢ Additionally, native environment development and Kotlin experience would be nice have

What we offer
‚Ä¢ Hybrid working model () and flexible working schedule
‚Ä¢ Private Health Insurance
‚Ä¢ 20 vacation days, increasing according to labour law
‚Ä¢ Extensive cafeteria package
‚Ä¢ People Lead system for your personal development
‚Ä¢ A culture of continuous growth, providing various training resources
‚Ä¢ Referral System
‚Ä¢ Technical equipment you can choose
‚Ä¢ Agile mindset, simplified processes, and a great atmosphere where commitment and autonomy are celebrated
‚Ä¢ A community-first mindset working with talented people across technology products and consulting

() This role requires working for a couple of days on-site in the client's office.

About us

Zenitech is a leading technology solutions provider dedicated to reshaping the global digital landscape. Headquartered in the UK, Zenitech operates internationally, with offices in Lithuania, Romania, and Hungary. We use a bespoke approach depending upon where the client is on their digital journey, comprising a combination of access to dedicated R&D labs, technology implementation advice, and specialist nearshore development talent. As an international community of individuals who are open to learn from each other, we collectively define and input into the digital future of the clients‚Äô businesses.

Why Zenitech?

Impactful Projects: Drive meaningful change in Banking/Financial industry through digital transformation projects.
Collaborative Culture: Be part of a diverse, inclusive team committed to growth, innovation, and continuous learning.
Professional Growth: Zenitech supports continuous learning and development, helping you advance your skills and career.

Diversity and Inclusion

Zenitech celebrates diversity in all its forms. We aim to create an inclusive environment where everyone feels valued for their unique contributions and perspectives. If you require any adjustments during the application process, please let us know‚Äîwe‚Äôre here to help.

jobs_results.title: Senior IOS Software Engineer
jobs_results.description:
The Role

As a Senior iOS Developer on the Design System Team, you will play a key role in the development and evolution of a unified, sophisticated design system for the client‚Äôs entire product platform. You will work with a cross-functional team to build and maintain iOS components within a sophisticated, component-based design system. This system is designed to improve the user experience across various product teams, enabling them to build modern, consistent interfaces.

What you will do
‚Ä¢ Design and develop iOS applications, focusing on iOS-specific UI components (SwiftUI, UIKit)
‚Ä¢ Work with other engineers to build out and refine the CI/CD pipelines that automate the deployment of iOS components
‚Ä¢ Maintain and enhance the front-end developer experience, collaborating closely with engineers working on the web components (React/Angular) and sharing best practices across platforms.

Requirements
‚Ä¢ 5+ years of professional experience in iOS development, with a strong portfolio of released iOS applications.
‚Ä¢ In-depth knowledge of Swift
‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with mobile app architecture patterns (MVC, MVVM, etc.) and best practices.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with UI component libraries such as Material UI, Angular Material, Ant Design, Chakra, or proprietary solutions.
‚Ä¢ Solid understanding of mobile UI/UX principles and accessibility standards.

What we offer
‚Ä¢ Hybrid / remote working model (*) and flexible working schedule
‚Ä¢ Private Health Insurance
‚Ä¢ People Lead system for your personal development
‚Ä¢ A culture of continuous growth, providing various training resources
‚Ä¢ Referral System
‚Ä¢ A community-first mindset, focusing on health-related initiatives, community events, team‚Äìbuildings
‚Ä¢ Technical equipment you can choose
‚Ä¢ Agile mindset, simplified processes, and a great atmosphere where commitment and autonomy are celebrated
‚Ä¢ Work with talented people across technology products and consulting

(*) As we hire permanent employees for this role, we offer remote opportunities only in Romania, Lithuania and Hungary.

About Us

Zenitech is a leading technology solutions provider dedicated to reshaping the global digital landscape. Headquartered in the UK, Zenitech operates internationally, with offices in Lithuania, Romania, and Hungary.

We use a bespoke approach depending upon where the client is on their digital journey, comprising a combination of access to dedicated R&D labs, technology implementation advice, and specialist nearshore development talent. As an international community of individuals who are open to learn from each other, we collectively define and input into the digital future of the clients‚Äô businesses.

Why Zenitech?
‚Ä¢ Impactful Projects: Drive meaningful change through digital transformation projects and have an opportunity to make an impact on many different industries.
‚Ä¢ Collaborative Culture: Be part of a diverse, inclusive team committed to growth, innovation, and continuous learning.
‚Ä¢ Professional Growth: Zenitech supports continuous learning and development through the People Lead system, helping you advance your skills and career.

Diversity and Inclusion

Zenitech celebrates diversity in all its forms. We aim to create an inclusive environment where everyone feels valued for their unique contributions and perspectives. If you require any adjustments during the application process, please let us know‚Äîwe‚Äôre here to help. Our commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging can be found here.

jobs_results.title: Senior iOS Engineer
jobs_results.description:
Who We Are:

At VML, we are a beacon of innovation and growth in an ever-evolving world. Our heritage is built upon a century of combined expertise, where creativity meets technology, and diverse perspectives ignite inspiration. With the merger of VMLY&R and Wunderman Thompson, we have forged a new path as a growth partner that is part creative agency, part consultancy, and part technology powerhouse.

Our global family now encompasses over 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 64 markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences. Our expertise spans the entire customer journey, offering deep insights in communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. We deliver end-to-end solutions that result in revolutionary work.

We require an outgoing Senior iOS developer who possesses a passion for pushing mobile technologies to the limits and will work with our team of talented engineers to design and build the next generation of our mobile applications.

We are looking for someone with at least 5 years' experience using iOS. A strong understanding of API's and interfacing with them from iOS is essential. However, most important for this role is initiative, a passion for learning, great communication and the drive to succeed. We are looking for team players that want to improve their own skills but also help newer developers reach their potential. We have a robust peer review and code management process along with full-integrated CI process. Experience with tools like Jenkins and Gitlab would be an advantage.

We own all our projects from start to finish and work with our customers on a long-term basis managing their applications. This provides developers with the ability to take real ownership of projects and also work to continuously improve them. You will work directly with our in-house design teams, back-end developers and project managers to create applications that are used by millions of people every month. With well over 15 million downloads of our applications your work will be seen by many millions of people.

What we want from you:
‚Ä¢ Strong background in iOS Development and Swift
‚Ä¢ At least basic knowledge of Objective-C
‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge of SwiftUI and UIKit
‚Ä¢ Collaborating with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features
‚Ä¢ Contributing to defining and maintaining coding standards
‚Ä¢ Experience using code versioning tools like Git and GitLab
‚Ä¢ Experience with a range of third-party libraries and APIs
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with push notifications, APIs and cloud messaging
‚Ä¢ Confident in making recommendations around technology advancements in frameworks and tooling
‚Ä¢ Mentoring and providing guidance to junior developers

In return, this is what you can expect from us:
‚Ä¢ Hybrid way of working (2 office days, 3 days working from home)
‚Ä¢ Private health insurance package (for employees working with us for a year and more)
‚Ä¢ International and in-house training possibilities
‚Ä¢ Education budget to suit your own development
‚Ä¢ International projects
‚Ä¢ Diverse teams (in 2023 our office has the the 'Most diverse Company' special award in the Loveable Workplace competition)

And there's more:
‚Ä¢ Kid and dog friendly office
‚Ä¢ Annual team building days and many fun events
‚Ä¢ Award-winning and well-equipped office

Our Enterprise Solutions division houses strategic consultants, creative and technical architects and skilled developers and operators that together help some of the world's leading organisations to deliver outstanding digital experiences across all major routes to market worldwide: marketplaces, online retailers, D2C, B2B and social platforms. With over 4,200 experts in 55 operational centres across 34 countries, our capabilities span the entire buying journey from customer acquisition, through engagement, to conversion and loyalty, driving multi-channel growth for world-leading brands.

We work with some of the most exciting brands such as The Coca-Cola Company, EY, Bosch, Unilever, Ford, DFS, Mercedes-Benz, Johnson & Johnson, Nestl√©, Sainsbury's, Selfridges, Shell and Tiffany & Co. We've built over 500 platforms for brands and retailers and generate in excess of $29bn annually for our clients and work with over 50 strategic partners including Adobe, SAP, Salesforce, HCL, Shopify, Sitecore, BigCommerce, commerce tools and Acquia. Our reputation is based on our people, and we believe we have some of the best in the business.

As our business grows internationally, we're looking for new people to join us on our journey to inspire and take a key role in shaping some of the best commerce solutions, services, and websites in the world. Working as a team, no problem is insurmountable; we share in our client's successes and believe that anyone can show creative bravery no matter what their role is in the team.

At VML, we are committed to fostering an all-inclusive work environment that is both rewarding and career-forward. Our Inclusion, Equity & Belonging initiatives, alongside the VML Foundation, reflect our dedication to giving back and making a positive impact in our communities and beyond. Our people are the heartbeat of our organization-creators, doers, innovators, makers, and thinkers-who drive not just marketing, but meaningful experiences that resonate in every action and interaction.

VML is a WPP Agency. For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML on our social channels via Instagram, LinkedIn, and X.

When you click "Submit Application", this will send any information you add below to VML. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Recruitment Privacy Policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it.
